alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 9:22PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 921 PM PDT, Trained weather spotters reported very heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nice Campground, Ruffed Grouse Campground, Honeymoon Campground, Flat Campground, Mazama, Chewuch Campground and Camp Four Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. The heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
